title: Accept a Walkie-Talkie Invitation: Talk to Friends

steps.title: Update your Apple Watch.
steps.content: Update your Apple Watch. Walkie-Talkie only works on watchOS 5.3 or later. To update your watch: [1] X Research source [2] X Research source Connect your watch to Wi-Fi. Open Settings on your watch. Go to General > Software Update . Tap Install .

steps.title: Update your iPhone.
steps.content: Update your iPhone. You need iOS 12.4 or later to use Walkie-Talkie. To update your iPhone: Open Settings. Go to General > Software Update . Tap Download and Install .

steps.title: Sign in to FaceTime.
steps.content: Sign in to FaceTime. Use your Apple ID to sign in to the FaceTime app on your iPhone. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Turn on FaceTime.
steps.content: Turn on FaceTime. Your iPhone’s FaceTime needs to be on to use Walkie-Talkie. If FaceTime has been turned off, go to Settings > FaceTime . Then tap the FaceTime toggle to switch it into the ON position.

steps.title: Turn on Walkie-Talkie.
steps.content: Turn on Walkie-Talkie. On your Apple Watch, tap the toggle next to “Walkie-Talkie” in the Walkie-Talkie app to switch it to the ON position. If you’re just getting started, check out how to pair your Apple Watch with your iPhone (you can always unpair it later if needed).

steps.title: Tap Add Friends.
steps.content: Tap Add Friends . In the Walkie-Talkie app, tap this button to choose a contact to add. You’ll need to wait for your friend to accept the invitation. Their Walkie-Talkie contact card will turn yellow once they accept.

steps.title: Tap the friend you want to call.
steps.content: Tap the friend you want to call. You can find your friends list in the Walkie-Talkie app. This will send them a notification to talk using Walkie-Talkie.

steps.title: Tap the notification to accept an invite.
steps.content: Tap the notification to accept an invite. You’ll get a notification on your Apple Watch when someone is calling you with Walkie-Talkie. [4] X Research source Tap Always Allow under the notification to make sure you continue to get Walkie-Talkie invites. Check the Notification Center if you missed the notification. If Walkie-Talkie isn’t working, try closing the app and reopening it. If there’s still an issue, delete the app and redownload it from the Apple Watch App Store.

steps.title: Note these additional troubleshooting tips.
steps.content: Note these additional troubleshooting tips. The Walkie-Talkie app occasionally has issues sending and receiving notifications. It uses FaceTime to make calls, which can cause problems. Here are a few things you can try to resolve the issue: Go to FaceTime in the iPhone Settings app. Under the section “you can be reached by FaceTime at,” make sure there is a checkmark next to your email address. Make a FaceTime call using your iPhone. Then, make a FaceTime call to that person again using the call history in the Apple Watch Phone app. Then, use Walkie-Talkie to call the person. Send the invite multiple times. It can take several attempts before the invitation shows up. Turn off Bluetooth. If you have an Apple Watch with a cellular plan, turn off Bluetooth on your iPhone. Then try using Walkie-Talkie to make a call.
